name: Bard
description: An inspiring magician whose power echoes music and performance.

1.name: Bardic Inspiration
1.description: As a bonus action, choose one creature other than yourself within 60 feet who can hear you to gain a Bardic Inspiration die, a d6. Within 10 minutes, the creature can add the die to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw. Uses equal your Charisma modifier (minimum 1) per long rest. Die becomes a d8 at 5th level, d10 at 10th, and d12 at 15th.

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: Learn bard cantrips and spells using Charisma as your spellcasting ability. You can cast rituals and use a musical instrument as a focus. You know four 1st-level spells and gain more as you level.

2.name: Jack of All Trades
2.description: Add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

2.name: Song of Rest (d6)
2.description: During a short rest, if you or friendly creatures who can hear your performance regain hit points by spending Hit Dice, each regains an extra 1d6 hit points.

2.name: Magical Inspiration
2.description: (Optional) A creature with your Bardic Inspiration that casts a spell to restore hit points or deal damage can roll the die and add it to one target's healing or damage.

3.name: Bard College
3.description: Choose a bard college, which grants features at 3rd, 6th, and 14th levels.

3.name: Expertise
3.description: Choose two of your skill proficiencies; your proficiency bonus is doubled for ability checks that use either of them.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1, or take a feat if allowed.

4.name: Bardic Versatility
4.description: (Optional) When you gain an Ability Score Improvement, you can replace one Expertise skill or swap a bard cantrip.

5.name: Bardic Inspiration (d8)
5.description: Your Bardic Inspiration die becomes a d8.

5.name: Font of Inspiration
5.description: Regain all expended uses of Bardic Inspiration when you finish a short or long rest.

6.name: Countercharm
6.description: As an action, perform to give you and allies within 30 feet advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed until the end of your next turn.

6.name: Bard College feature
6.description: You gain a feature from your chosen Bard College.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1, or take a feat if allowed.

9.name: Song of Rest (d8)
9.description: The extra hit points regained from Song of Rest increase to 1d8.

10.name: Bardic Inspiration (d10)
10.description: Your Bardic Inspiration die becomes a d10.

10.name: Expertise
10.description: Choose two additional skill proficiencies to gain Expertise in.

10.name: Magical Secrets
10.description: Learn two spells from any classes. The chosen spells count as bard spells for you and are included in the number of spells you know.

13.name: Song of Rest (d10)
13.description: The extra hit points regained from Song of Rest increase to 1d10.

14.name: Magical Secrets
14.description: Learn two additional spells from any classes; they count as bard spells for you.

14.name: Bard College feature
14.description: You gain a feature from your chosen Bard College.

15.name: Bardic Inspiration (d12)
15.description: Your Bardic Inspiration die becomes a d12.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement

17.name: Song of Rest (d12)
17.description: The extra hit points regained from Song of Rest increase to 1d12.

18.name: Magical Secrets
18.description: Learn two additional spells from any classes; they count as bard spells for you.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: Increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1, or take a feat if allowed.

20.name: Superior Inspiration
20.description: When you roll initiative and have no uses of Bardic Inspiration left, you regain one use.
